TopicTitle: Vagani Car Manufacturers- Get Inspired- Final Challenge

Articles.Content: I'm alright with that just don't give me a virus ok xD
I'm fine with mediafire
Yeah mediafire is good

kk, so then, the final challenge is to produce a short clip that shows your car, falling from a great height, this will be an advert, and so requires:

-The product

-Cost

-Features

-Your name at the end, and possibly your profile picture

-Inspirational music

-Epic camera shots, Kerbcam might help

Here is an example, not from KSP, but i want you to make something similar, and of course put a spin on it.

Upload the finished video to mediafire or what ever downloading thing, so that I can download it and watch it. Although if you do have a youtube channel, post it on there for simplicity, good luck.

kk, so then, the final challenge is to produce a short clip that shows your car, falling from a great height, this will be an advert, and so requires:

wait a second I have seen that advert before!! It was on James mays cars of the people
yes yes it was
new it!!!!

Ok Vagani, I'll quit the competition.

I would have to install video-/postproduction-/compression software for it, witch was not my intention (look at my OP) at all.

Additionally i will delete parts of my OP and the pictures in it to clear space on imgur after the contest.

Besides: If an company (Mediafire) wants me to install a program to be able to up- or download, then is something wrong with it and for me an no-go.

For the remaining guys: Good luck!

I was just wondering what video capture software people are using for this as I have never done this before.
use the free version of bandicam, it lets you record 10 minutes of video, i use it as you can see by the water mark, and modded parts are allowed yes

I use fraps I think it's very good and records at good quality ( don't think it's free )
